name: Research Object Submission Form
description: Aperture is now accepting Research Object Submissions. Please fill out the form below to complete your submission.
popuptitle: By submitting the manuscript, you agree to the following statements.
popupdescription:
The corresponding author confirms that all co-authors are included, and that everyone listed as a co-author agrees to that role and all the following requirements and acknowledgements. All authors confirm that they have helped revise and approve the submission.

The submission represents original work and sources are given proper attribution. The journal employs a similarity check to compare submissions against a large and growing database of published scholarly content. If in the judgment of a senior editor a submission is genuinely suspected of plagiarism, it will be returned to the author(s) with a request for explanation.

The research was conducted in accordance with ethical principles.

There is a Data Accessibility Statement, containing information about the location of open data and materials, in the manuscript.

children.title: Title
children.name: submission.$title
children.description: Please enter the title of your Research Object as you would like it to appear once published. PLEASE DO NOT USE ALL CAPS. Use the example below as a guide: "An fMRI Study on Word Recognition". Please do not use Subscript, Superscript, boldface and/or italics in your Title

children.title: Authors
children.name: submission.$authors
children.description:
Please enter the author names, titles, contact information and affiliations in the order they appear in your manuscript.

Please include the email address of at least your contributing or first author. The email addresses of the rest of the co-authors is not required. Any submitted email address will be made public with the work if published.  

Multiple affiliations can be seperated by a comma.

Initials and Middle intials can be added in the First Name field.

children.title: Cover letter
children.name: submission.cover
children.description: Please upload a cover letter that summarizes the contributions of your Research Object and any other relevant or timely information to consider. Do not upload your abstract here. You may upload your cover letter as a PDF in the “Uploads” step. Please address your Cover Letter to the Editor-in-Chief, Dr. Tonya White.

children.title: Type of Research Object
children.name: submission.objectType
children.description: Please select the Research Object type(s) that best match your submission and include a link to the supporting elements if applicable. If you are linking to a preprint server or hosting site, we ask that you use reliable and accessible sites.

children.title: Abstract
children.name: submission.$abstract
children.description: Please provide a short summary of your submission.

children.title: Data Availability Statements
children.name: submission.dataCode
children.description:
Please select from the following list to confirm that the data are or are not available, and the conditions and means in which your data will be available.

If your data would fit under multiple accessibility statements, please explain in the following text field.

options.label: Available: The data is available and downloadable by anyone.
options.value: Available: The data is available and downloadable by anyone.

options.label: Quick Access: The data is accessible after an access request process typically taking 24 hours or less. •	Routine Review Required: The data is accessible after an access request process typically taking 7 days or less.
options.value: Quick Access: The data is accessible after an access request process typically taking 24 hours or less. •	Routine Review Required: The data is accessible after an access request process typically taking 7 days or less.

options.label: Detailed Review Required: The data is accessible after an access request process that may take more than 7 days, possibly including detailed review of proposed use of the data.
options.value: Detailed Review Required: The data is accessible after an access request process that may take more than 7 days, possibly including detailed review of proposed use of the data.

options.label: Collaboration Required: The data is accessible after an access request process that depends on collaboration with the project team responsible for the data.
options.value: Collaboration Required: The data is accessible after an access request process that depends on collaboration with the project team responsible for the data.

options.label: No Data: No new research data were acquired or generated for this Research Object
options.value: No Data: No new research data were acquired or generated for this Research Object

children.title: Code Availability Statements
children.name: submission.codeAvailability

options.label: Available: The code is available and downloadable by anyone
options.value: Available: The code is available and downloadable by anyone

options.label: No Code: No code was generated as part of the creation of this Research Object
options.value: No Code: No code was generated as part of the creation of this Research Object

children.title: Data availability statements Cont.
children.name: submission.dataCodeContinued
children.description:
Please use this field to explain your selections above and include any other supporting information about your data.

If the Research Object does not report on new empirical data nor create it directly, please state that “No new research data were acquired or generated for this Research Object."

Reminder: The statement, “Data will be available on reasonable request” is not sufficient. Please confirm that the data are or are not available, and the conditions and means in which your data will be available.

If your Research Object does not include data, please put NA.

Please include any available DOI’s.
children.placeholder: Enter your data and code availability statement

children.name: submission.ethics

children.title: References
children.name: submission.references
children.description:
References must be included in the manuscript and formatted as per the author's preference with the initial submission.

If asked to submit revisions, authors will be asked to format their references in Vancouver Style and include these in the Submission Form Here.

children.title: Suggested reviewers
children.name: submission.suggested
children.description:
Aperture Neuro encourages authors to recommend potential Peer Reviewers for their Research Object provided there is no conflict of interest. A conflict of interest describes any situation that skews or interferes with Aperture’s objective and open peer review and publication processes. Personal, financial, and professional competing interests should be considered. We require all authors to declare any and all competing interests, and failure to do so could result in the rejection of your Research Object.

Please list at least six reviewer suggestions and include name, affiliation, and contact information.
